sub_topic: Calculation of standard enthalpy change for a reaction involving aqueous solutions
message_1:
Calculate the standard enthalpy change for the reaction: 

CuSO4 (aq) + 4NH3 (aq) -> Cu(NH3)4SO4 (aq) 

given that the standard enthalpy changes of formation for CuSO4 (aq) and NH3 (aq) are -771.5 kJ/mol and -46.19 kJ/mol respectively, and the standard enthalpy change of formation for Cu(NH3)4SO4 (aq) is -2130.4 kJ/mol.
message_2:
To calculate the standard enthalpy change for the reaction, we can use Hess's Law, which states that the total enthalpy change for a reaction is the sum of the enthalpy changes of formation for the products minus the sum of the enthalpy changes of formation for the reactants.

ΔH_reaction = Σ ΔH_f(products) - Σ ΔH_f(reactants)

For the given reaction:

CuSO4 (aq) + 4NH3 (aq) -> Cu(NH3)4SO4 (aq)

ΔH_reaction = [ΔH_f(Cu(NH3)4SO4)] - [ΔH_f(CuSO4) + 4 * ΔH_f(NH3)]

ΔH_reaction = [-2130.4 kJ/mol] - [(-771.5 kJ/mol) + 4 * (-46.19 kJ/mol)]

ΔH_reaction = -2130.4 kJ/mol + 771.5 kJ/mol + 4 * 46.19 kJ/mol

ΔH_reaction = -2130.4 kJ/mol + 771.5 kJ/mol + 184.76 kJ/mol

ΔH_reaction = -1174.14 kJ/mol

The standard enthalpy change for the reaction is -1174.14 kJ/mol.
